<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/12/microsoft-buy-speech-tech-company-nuance-16b?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Microsoft Goes for the Nuanced Argument
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/12/microsoft-buy-speech-tech-company-nuance-16b" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="An illustration of a microphone in front of a turquoise background with the Microsoft logo and name emblazoned on the silver metal handle. " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NzEzL21pY3Jvc29mdF9taWNyb3Bob25lLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While you were scouring the internet for a Telfar Shopping Bag, Microsoft was eyeing some slightly bigger investments. The company just <a href="https://apnews.com/article/business-3d0298725cd320fdbc321ba9c1d432f2?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced</a> its second-largest purchase ever: $16 billion for Nuance Communications.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We're assuming you know Microsoft, which at $1.93 trillion is the world's second-most valuable public company. What's the lowdown on Nuance?</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">There's lots to talk about</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Massachusetts-based Nuance uses artificial intelligence to process and transcribe speech. Sounds straightforward, but it takes pretty advanced tech for machines to capture the...er, nuance of human language. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Nuance was a pioneer in voice recognition and once powered Siri's backend. But competition came quick: Following advances in deep learning (a subset of AI) in the 2010s, Big Tech companies <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/04/12/business/microsoft-nuance-artificial-intelligence.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">built their own</a> expertise and Apple brought Siri software in-house. Nuance has since refocused on serving specific markets, particularly healthcare, where its tools transcribe doctor-patient conversations and update medical records. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In the US, over half of physicians and three-quarters of hospitals use Nuance software.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Microsoft has also cozied up to doctors, and not for leftover vaccine hookups. Its healthcare cloud revenue grew 37% annually in 2020, and last fall the company <a href="https://www.zdnet.com/article/microsofts-first-vertical-cloud-the-microsoft-cloud-for-healthcare-is-now-generally-available/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">launched</a> its first industry-specific bundle of cloud offerings for the healthcare space. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>With Nuance, Microsoft scores a big list of healthcare clients + lots of speech data, which is important for building and fine-tuning those AI systems. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture:</strong> Microsoft worked on speech tech for years, but has had less success in the consumer market than Amazon or Google. The Nuance acquisition could catapult it ahead.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Speaking of Amazon and Google...</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While they're preoccupied with Zoom antitrust hearings, Microsoft's <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/04/12/microsoft-hunts-for-big-acquisitions-as-antitrust-spotlight-on-rivals.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">gone fishing</a> with $132 billion in cash on hand:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It tried buying TikTok last year. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>This year, it reportedly dangled over $50 billion in front of Pinterest and is in talks to buy Discord for $10+ billion. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> Microsoft's lawyers have stayed busy under CEO Satya Nadella, who's overseen high-profile deals including buying LinkedIn for $26 billion, GitHub for $7.5 billion, and video game maker ZeniMax for $7.6 billion. </p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FILM & TV
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/12/will-smiths-upcoming-movie-pulls-georgia-new-voting-law?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Show Must not Go on in Georgia
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/12/will-smiths-upcoming-movie-pulls-georgia-new-voting-law" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Will Smith headshot at movie premiere" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NzExL3dpbGxfc21pdGguanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Kevin Winter/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Will Smith and director Antoine Fuqua <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/04/12/will-smith-antoine-fuqua-will-no-longer-film-emancipation-in-georgia.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced</a> yesterday they would pull production of their upcoming film out of Georgia because of the state's new controversial <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/06/tldr-georgias-voting-law?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">voting law</a>. CEOs of major corporations based in the state have publicly opposed the law, and MLB has moved its All-Star Game from Atlanta, but this is the first major film production to back out.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why it's a big deal.</strong> Georgia has spent the last two decades transforming itself into a film and TV powerhouse, locking in productions with Netflix, HBO Max, and the best <em>Spider-Man</em> (it's Tom Holland, don't even start). The state brings in ~$9.5 billion a year from direct and indirect production spending by offering 30% uncapped tax credits for any film major with a dream.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>If you wanted to make a feature film in California, you'd qualify for a 20% tax credit that would be capped at $100 million.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> Hollywood has stayed relatively quiet about Georgia's new law, but if more creators follow Smith and Fuqua, it could threaten one of the state's fastest-growing industries.</p>

<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2021%2F04%2F12%2Fwill-smiths-upcoming-movie-pulls-georgia-new-voting-law" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

</a><span>  </span>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FINTECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/12/ant-group-forced-undergo-major-restructuring?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Chinese Government Flexes on Jack Ma
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/12/ant-group-forced-undergo-major-restructuring" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Jack Ma" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNjAzL2phY2tfbWEuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Wang HE/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Ant Group, the world's largest fintech company, is undergoing a major restructuring with the reluctance of someone checking their email after a week-long vacation.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Chinese government ordered Ant to <a href="https://apnews.com/article/hong-kong-china-initial-public-offerings-c607f580daf9a8fb21250799bacd8543?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">transition</a> to a "financial holding" company and take other measures to distance its payments arm and its lending products.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>You might remember Ant from last November, when its IPO—projected to be the biggest ever—was <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/11/08/ants-ipo-got-squashed?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">halted by regulators</a>.  </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>It wasn't clear exactly </span><span><em>why</em></span><span> proceedings stopped but, the month before the planned offering, Jack Ma, the billionaire controlling shareholder of Ant and cofounder of Ant's sister company, Alibaba, criticized Chinese officials in a high-profile speech. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday's crackdown shows that the Chinese government thinks <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/04/12/technology/ant-group-alibaba-china.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">now is the time</a> to rein in the country's tech giants. On Friday, regulators fined Alibaba a record $2.8 billion over uncompetitive practices.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Alibaba may have gotten off a lot better than Ant. While the government's order threatens Ant's business model, Alibaba <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/how-a-2-8-billion-fine-added-40-billion-to-alibaba-11618224483?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">added $40 billion</a> in market value yesterday because investors viewed its punishment as rather light. </p>

<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/12/key-performance-indicators?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Key Performance Indicators
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/12/key-performance-indicators" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="A Harvard University building" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNzkvaGFydmFyZF91bml2ZXJzaXR5LnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Harvard University</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>If you got rejected from an Ivy this year, don't sweat it—so did virtually everyone. Harvard's acceptance rate <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/ivy-league-acceptance-rates-fall-to-record-lows-due-to-covid-19-11617767857?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fell to 3.4%</a> from 5.2% and Columbia's dropped to 3.7% from 6.1%. This happened for a number of Covid-induced reasons, including a) more applications than ever as colleges dropped standardized test requirements and b) lots of deferments last year, tightening the number of spots available this year.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote:</strong> "When the road is clear for cannabis, when federal laws come into play, we're absolutely going to take a look at it."</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In an interview with CNBC, Uber CEO Dara Khosrowshahi hinted that one day you might be able to <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/04/12/uber-ceo-says-company-could-get-into-cannabis-delivery.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">order marijuana delivery</a> via the Uber app...and then open it again to order Uber Eats. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Khosrowshahi is high on the company's trajectory. Yesterday, Uber said total monthly bookings, which include ride-hailing and food delivery, hit record levels in March. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>The future of work is a pyramid scheme, where every person sells his favorite person to the next person. (<a href="https://www.drorpoleg.com/the-ponzi-career/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Dror Poleg</a>)</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
DELIVERY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/12/dominos-partners-nuro-deliver-pizza-via-driverless-vehicle?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Latest in Pizza Tech
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/12/dominos-partners-nuro-deliver-pizza-via-driverless-vehicle" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Nuro's R2 driverless vehicle drives on a california road" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/OjJbbiCtMzFiywYIgB/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Nuro's R2 driverless vehicle drives on a california road" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/OjJbbiCtMzFiywYIgB/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Nuro</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Whether it's an extensive <a href="https://news.avclub.com/the-story-behind-domino-s-we-re-sorry-for-sucking-cam-1798259162?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">apology campaign</a> or its unhinged plan to <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-06-14/why-domino-s-pizza-is-fixing-potholes-now?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fill potholes</a>, Domino's has always been the king of pizza biz innovation. The chain is ready to one-up itself yet again by using Nuro's driverless cars to <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2021/4/12/22379853/nuro-self-driving-robot-delivery-dominos-pizza-houston?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">deliver pizzas</a> in Houston this week. Nuro's R2 is the first driverless vehicle to be approved by the US Department of Transportation, and it's already been used to transport groceries and medical supplies.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Only the best for the best. </strong>From a sales and drunk on High Life POV, Domino's pizza is the top pizza chain in the country.<strong style="color:#000"> </strong>But<strong style="color:#000"> </strong>our colleague Toby is <a href="https://twitter.com/tobydoyhowell/status/1381648930530803718?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">right</a>—it's also a tech company. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>From 2012 to 2019, Domino's consistently grew revenue by 12% per year and, since the company's reinvention in 2009, it became the first pizza company to offer mobile ordering and build its very own digital pizza tracker.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>this is R2’s first test delivering for a restaurant, but things are looking bright for the little guy. Chipotle invested in Nuro's $500 million Series C funding round last month and the company was just approved at the end of last year to begin testing on public roads in California.</p>

collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhile you were scouring the internet for a Telfar Shopping Bag, Microsoft was eyeing some slightly bigger investments. The company just \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/business-3d0298725cd320fdbc321ba9c1d432f2?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounced\u003c/a\u003e its second-largest purchase ever: $16 billion for Nuance Communications.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWe're assuming you know Microsoft, which at $1.93 trillion is the world's second-most valuable public company. What's the lowdown on Nuance?\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThere's lots to talk about\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMassachusetts-based Nuance uses artificial intelligence to process and transcribe speech. Sounds straightforward, but it takes pretty advanced tech for machines to capture the...er, nuance of human language. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNuance was a pioneer in voice recognition and once powered Siri's backend. But competition came quick: Following advances in deep learning (a subset of AI) in the 2010s, Big Tech companies \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/04/12/business/microsoft-nuance-artificial-intelligence.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebuilt their own\u003c/a\u003e expertise and Apple brought Siri software in-house. Nuance has since refocused on serving specific markets, particularly healthcare, where its tools transcribe doctor-patient conversations and update medical records. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn the US, over half of physicians and three-quarters of hospitals use Nuance software.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMicrosoft has also cozied up to doctors, and not for leftover vaccine hookups. Its healthcare cloud revenue grew 37% annually in 2020, and last fall the company \u003ca href=\"https://www.zdnet.com/article/microsofts-first-vertical-cloud-the-microsoft-cloud-for-healthcare-is-now-generally-available/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elaunched\u003c/a\u003e its first industry-specific bundle of cloud offerings for the healthcare space. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWith Nuance, Microsoft scores a big list of healthcare clients + lots of speech data, which is important for building and fine-tuning those AI systems. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture:\u003c/strong\u003e Microsoft worked on speech tech for years, but has had less success in the consumer market than Amazon or Google. The Nuance acquisition could catapult it ahead.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eSpeaking of Amazon and Google...\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhile they're preoccupied with Zoom antitrust hearings, Microsoft's \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/04/12/microsoft-hunts-for-big-acquisitions-as-antitrust-spotlight-on-rivals.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egone fishing\u003c/a\u003e with $132 billion in cash on hand:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt tried buying TikTok last year. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThis year, it reportedly dangled over $50 billion in front of Pinterest and is in talks to buy Discord for $10+ billion. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e Microsoft's lawyers have stayed busy under CEO Satya Nadella, who's overseen high-profile deals including buying LinkedIn for $26 billion, GitHub for $7.5 billion, and video game maker ZeniMax for $7.6 billion. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWill Smith and director Antoine Fuqua \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/04/12/will-smith-antoine-fuqua-will-no-longer-film-emancipation-in-georgia.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounced\u003c/a\u003e yesterday they would pull production of their upcoming film out of Georgia because of the state's new controversial \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/06/tldr-georgias-voting-law?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003evoting law\u003c/a\u003e. CEOs of major corporations based in the state have publicly opposed the law, and MLB has moved its All-Star Game from Atlanta, but this is the first major film production to back out.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy it's a big deal.\u003c/strong\u003e Georgia has spent the last two decades transforming itself into a film and TV powerhouse, locking in productions with Netflix, HBO Max, and the best \u003cem\u003eSpider-Man\u003c/em\u003e (it's Tom Holland, don't even start). The state brings in ~$9.5 billion a year from direct and indirect production spending by offering 30% uncapped tax credits for any film major with a dream.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIf you wanted to make a feature film in California, you'd qualify for a 20% tax credit that would be capped at $100 million.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line:\u003c/strong\u003e Hollywood has stayed relatively quiet about Georgia's new law, but if more creators follow Smith and Fuqua, it could threaten one of the state's fastest-growing industries.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnt Group, the world's largest fintech company, is undergoing a major restructuring with the reluctance of someone checking their email after a week-long vacation.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Chinese government ordered Ant to \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/hong-kong-china-initial-public-offerings-c607f580daf9a8fb21250799bacd8543?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etransition\u003c/a\u003e to a \"financial holding\" company and take other measures to distance its payments arm and its lending products.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eYou might remember Ant from last November, when its IPO—projected to be the biggest ever—was \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/11/08/ants-ipo-got-squashed?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehalted by regulators\u003c/a\u003e.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIt wasn't clear exactly \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003ewhy\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e proceedings stopped but, the month before the planned offering, Jack Ma, the billionaire controlling shareholder of Ant and cofounder of Ant's sister company, Alibaba, criticized Chinese officials in a high-profile speech. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday's crackdown shows that the Chinese government thinks \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/04/12/technology/ant-group-alibaba-china.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enow is the time\u003c/a\u003e to rein in the country's tech giants. On Friday, regulators fined Alibaba a record $2.8 billion over uncompetitive practices.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eAlibaba may have gotten off a lot better than Ant. While the government's order threatens Ant's business model, Alibaba \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/how-a-2-8-billion-fine-added-40-billion-to-alibaba-11618224483?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eadded $40 billion\u003c/a\u003e in market value yesterday because investors viewed its punishment as rather light. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL \u003c/strong\u003eIf you got rejected from an Ivy this year, don't sweat it—so did virtually everyone. Harvard's acceptance rate \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/ivy-league-acceptance-rates-fall-to-record-lows-due-to-covid-19-11617767857?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efell to 3.4%\u003c/a\u003e from 5.2% and Columbia's dropped to 3.7% from 6.1%. This happened for a number of Covid-induced reasons, including a) more applications than ever as colleges dropped standardized test requirements and b) lots of deferments last year, tightening the number of spots available this year.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eQuote:\u003c/strong\u003e \"When the road is clear for cannabis, when federal laws come into play, we're absolutely going to take a look at it.\"\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn an interview with CNBC, Uber CEO Dara Khosrowshahi hinted that one day you might be able to \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/04/12/uber-ceo-says-company-could-get-into-cannabis-delivery.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eorder marijuana delivery\u003c/a\u003e via the Uber app...and then open it again to order Uber Eats. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eKhosrowshahi is high on the company's trajectory. Nuro's R2 is the first driverless vehicle to be approved by the US Department of Transportation, and it's already been used to transport groceries and medical supplies.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eOnly the best for the best. \u003c/strong\u003eFrom a sales and drunk on High Life POV, Domino's pizza is the top pizza chain in the country.\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e \u003c/strong\u003eBut\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e \u003c/strong\u003eour colleague Toby is \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/tobydoyhowell/status/1381648930530803718?s=20\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eright\u003c/a\u003e—it's also a tech company. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFrom 2012 to 2019, Domino's consistently grew revenue by 12% per year and, since the company's reinvention in 2009, it became the first pizza company to offer mobile ordering and build its very own digital pizza tracker.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ethis is R2’s first test delivering for a restaurant, but things are looking bright for the little guy.
